Based on your preferences, I would recommend "The English Patient" which stars Geoffrey Rush and Kate Winslet.

The movie is set during World War II in a desert hospital that serves as a refuge for injured soldiers from both sides of the war.

When a wounded soldier named Prince Philip (played by Geoffrey Rush)) is brought to the hospital's care, he meets the hospital's head nurse, Mrs. Elizabeth Agnes Tuck (played by Kate Winslet)), who is known throughout the world for her ability to heal the deepest wounds caused by physical and emotional trauma.

As Prince Philip and Mrs. Tuck work together to help Prince Philip recover from his injuries, they also begin to develop feelings for each other.

However, their relationship is complicated by a number of factors, including Prince Philip's status as a member of the royal family, Mrs. Tuck's status as a head nurse working in a hospital that serves as a refuge for injured soldiers from both sides of the war, and a number of other factors.

Despite these challenges, Prince Philip and Mrs. Tuck are able to find a way to work together and overcome these challenges, which ultimately leads to them developing feelings for each other.

As they continue to work together to help Prince Philip recover from his injuries, and continue to develop feelings for each other, they also begin to realize that their relationship is not just about helping Prince Philip recover from his injuries, and continue to develop feelings for each other, but also about helping each other navigate the challenges of life, including both physical and emotional trauma.
